snippet: On a trip to Scotland, where nationalists support nuclear disarmament,  Prime Minister David Cameron cited tensions with Iran and North Korea in defending Britain’s nuclear-armed submarines.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron offers strong defense of Britain's nuclear deterrent during trip to Scotland to challenge nationalists seeking independence, who want to expel nuclear-armed submarines from Scottish bases; cites tensions with Iran and North Korea.
lead_paragraph: On a trip to Scotland, where nationalists support nuclear disarmament,  Prime Minister David Cameron cited tensions with Iran and North Korea in defending Britain’s nuclear-armed submarines.

headline.seo: Cameron Urges Support for Nuclear Deterrent
headline.main: British Premier Says Nuclear Risks Highlight Need for Deterrent
headline.print_headline: British Premier Says Nuclear Risks Highlight Need for Deterrent
